Steps.Message: Update at 19:41 - Our engineers have arrived on site in the Melbourne Road area. We understand it can be really frustrating not knowing a time for when power will be back. We'll continue to liaise with our engineers and provide this information as soon as possible. In the current pandemic, a power cut can be especially disruptive, as you may be working from home, or taking care of elderly or unwell family members, and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Please follow the government guidelines about social distancing when interacting with our staff.

We became aware of a power cut at 18:50. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

We'll continue to liaise with our engineers and provide this information as soon as possible. In the current pandemic, a power cut can be especially disruptive, as you may be working from home, or taking care of elderly or unwell family members, and we want to support you however we can. IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Our engineers are currently working to find out what caused this power cut.
